assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. 2018.31.08-03.06; FALCON-Unzip + Arrow v. 6.0.0.47841; purge_dups v. github ca23030ccf4254dfd2d3a5ea90d0eed41c24f88b; Bionano solve v. 3.2.1_04122018; Salsa HiC v. 2.2; Arrow polishing + gap filling v. SMRTlink_6.0.0.47841; longranger alignment v. 2.2.2; freebayes polishing v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 26 SEP 2019; VGP assembly pipeline v. 1.6

biosample.biomaterialProvider: Christian Rutz, University of St Andrews, UK

description.comment: The New Caledonian crow (Corvus moneduloides) is endemic to the island of New Caledonia in the South Pacific. The species is renowned for its habit of manufacturing tools from plant materials, to extract prey from deadwood and vegetation. The sample was collected as part of a long-term field study led by Christian Rutz, from the University of St Andrews, and used to generate a chromosomal level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Model organism or animal sample from Corvus moneduloides

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: New Caledonian crow sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments:
The bCorMon1 primary assembly is based on the VGP 1.6 individual pipeline. Primary haplotype: Initial PacBio contig assembly with Falcon-unzip, Arrow polishing, retained haplotig identification with Purge Haplotigs, Arrow polishing and gap filling, and two rounds of FreeBayes polishing with Illumina short reads. Finally, the assembly was curated and chromosomes annotated using gEVAL
#This assembly represents the principal haplotype of the diploid genome orvus moneduloides and includes the chromosomes. The alternate haplotype sequences are in WGS project WHPP00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
